intro: Tetrastigma simplicifolia, commonly known as the simple-leaved cross-vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with three to five leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically followed by yellowish berries. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural and ecological studies.
